vote.title: Protecting the Health and Safety of Students, Families and Staff as Schools Reopen
vote.description: Whereas, The families of the Los Angeles Unified School District have been hit by an unprecedented global pandemic with devastating health consequences and have suffered traumatic losses of loved ones;Whereas, The pandemic has had disproportionately negative consequences for local families and communities based on factors of geography, race and ethnicity, and family income;Whereas, The District is committed to taking every step possible to ensure that the health of our students, families, employees and communities is protected;Whereas, Approximately 70 percent of District parents and families chose not to send their students back to in person instruction this spring;Whereas, Building parent, student, and family confidence regarding health protections as we fully reopen and return to our campuses must be the highest priority the District must address in order to ensure an effective and successful reopening process;  Whereas, The District will be receiving an unprecedented amount of new revenues that include funding specifically for pandemic related health protocols; andWhereas, As an outcome of the 2019 collective bargaining agreement with United Teachers Los Angeles (UTLA) and the District, the District is committed to providing a school nurse on every campus and has since hired additional nurses, but has not yet fully fulfilled this term of the agreement; now, therefore, be itResolved, That the Los Angeles Unified School District shall ensure that every school campus has a full-time, five days per week, school nurse in order to care for the well-being of students and staff upon reopening; Resolved further, That, in the instances where the District has made every attempt to fill the position of school nurse on a particular campus, including proper posting and robust recruitment and outreach, but where no qualified applicants are available, a full-time, five days per week Licensed Vocational Nurse (LVN) shall be employed and receive technical support by an RN assigned to the siteâ€™s local Community of Schools until such time as a full-time school nurse can be hired. When neither a certificated school nurse, nor an LVN is available, the Personnel Commission will be asked to identify or develop an appropriately trained health care support position to meet the needs of students and staff that will also be supported by ongoing technical support from the RN referenced above until a full-time school nurse can be hired;  Resolved further, That the District shall ensure that all parents, families, and students have access to timely and accurate information concerning the physical reopening of our campuses and that school site administrators will be responsible for effectively and accurately communicating relevant reopening policies and procedures to their school communities;Resolved further, That the District shall ensure that all schools have ongoing and thorough deep cleaning to protect all students and staff against the spread of the coronavirus and that all students and staff have full access to appropriate personal protective equipment; and, be it finallyResolved, That the District shall ensure that all students, families and staff have access to vaccines and that this provision of vaccinations shall be prioritized by service to our highest needs and most highly impacted school communities.
